message.content:
Analysis of the Target Tower
--------------------------------
From bottom to top, the tower can be seen as six “layers”:

1)  Bottom Yellow Ring  
   • Made from four flat, yellow rectangular blocks arranged in a ring.  
2)  Red Circular‐Hole Ring  
   • Formed by four quarter‐circle red pieces that create the round opening in the center.  
3)  Middle Yellow Ring  
   • Again four flat, yellow rectangular blocks in a ring just above the circular hole.  
4)  Red‐and‐Blue Cube Layer  
   • A ring of four cubes: three red cubes and one blue cube (the blue one at the front).  
5)  Green Ring  
   • Four small green rectangular blocks arranged in a narrow ring.  
6)  Orange “Roof”  
   • A square‐based pyramid formed by four orange wedge‐shaped blocks.  

Required Blocks from the Dictionary
------------------------------------
• Yellow rectangular block (flat/horizontal): index 9  
   – Needed 8 times total (4 for the bottom ring, 4 for the middle ring).  
• Red quarter‐circle blocks: indices 2 and 3  
   – Needed 2 of block 2 and 2 of block 3 to form the circular hole.  
• Red cube: index 5  
   – Needed 3 times (upper layer).  
• Blue cube: index 4  
   – Needed once (front cube in the upper layer).  
• Green rectangular block (horizontal): index 7  
   – Needed 4 times (green belt).  
• Orange roof wedges: indices 13, 14, 15, 16  
   – Needed 1 each to form the four triangular faces of the roof.  

Step‐by‐Step Assembly
----------------------
{  
  Step1: Move block with index 9  
  Step2: Move block with index 9  
  Step3: Move block with index 9  
  Step4: Move block with index 9  

  Step5: Move block with index 2  
  Step6: Move block with index 2  
  Step7: Move block with index 3  
  Step8: Move block with index 3  

  Step9: Move block with index 9  
  Step10: Move block with index 9  
  Step11: Move block with index 9  
  Step12: Move block with index 9  

  Step13: Move block with index 4  
  Step14: Move block with index 5  
  Step15: Move block with index 5  
  Step16: Move block with index 5  

  Step17: Move block with index 7  
  Step18: Move block with index 7  
  Step19: Move block with index 7  
  Step20: Move block with index 7  

  Step21: Move block with index 13  
  Step22: Move block with index 14  
  Step23: Move block with index 15  
  Step24: Move block with index 16  
}  

Explanation of the Build
-------------------------
1.  Lay four yellow blocks (index 9) in a ring for the base.  
2.  Place four quarter‐circle red blocks (2 × index 2, 2 × index 3) on top to form the circular hole.  
3.  Add another ring of four yellow blocks (index 9).  
4.  Build the next layer with one blue cube (index 4) and three red cubes (index 5).  
5.  Arrange four small green rectangular blocks (index 7) to make the “belt.”  
6.  Top it off with four orange wedges (indices 13, 14, 15, 16) to form the square‐based pyramid roof.
